page.title: 17YOXALL_HISTORY & BUILDINGS
page.content: Yoxall began as a mediaeval "street" village (buildings following the line of the street).The street enters Yoxall parish at the 14th C Yoxall Bridge,continues along the line of what is now Victoria St. and turns left just before reaching the River Swarbourn.There are 2 small village greens _School Green and Goose Green. Traces of the layout of the old open field system of agriculture still remain.The Moat,Town Hill is the site of the old manor of Yoxall and still has a deep dry moat.The present house was built from the remains of an earlier manor house and nearby water mill which were demolished in 1897. The first lord of the manor in 1086 was the Bishop of Chester, followed by the Ferrers family until 1265 and then by the Earls of Lancaster until sometime prior to 1322.
